metadata.synopsis: Interaction dialog with the automatic printer in the Baldurs Mouth basement. Lets you check the current headlines in the machine or load new ones.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Use the printer in the Baldurs Mouth basement. CTY_Main_A coords -1024, 0, 1015 Set the flag SCL_Drider_Event_PixieReleased to see the most helpful version of the gremlins dialog.

25.speaker: Printing Press
25.text: It was surely fun while it lasted - but looks like the late Lord Gortash has nabbed your headline spot.
25.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player walks towards the imposing printer, rumbling away. - REUSE ANIMATION FROM N45

82.speaker: Narrator
82.text: *Your attention is drawn to a metal block loaded into a slot labelled 'Headline Article'.*

57.speaker: Player
57.text: Check the headline currently in the printer.

80.speaker: Narrator
80.text: *The Mouth's next edition appears to be led by a piece commemorating the late Lord Gortash.*

68.speaker: Player
68.text: Load another headline in to the printer.

6.speaker: Player
6.text: Force the printing press open and clear the loaded headline.

106.speaker: Player
106.text: Reach inside and carefully remove the loaded headline.

39.speaker: Player
39.text: Dislodge the current headline with a precise flick of the wrist.

44.speaker: Player
44.text: Wrench the printing press open and rip out the loaded headline.

40.speaker: Printing Press
40.text: Ohoho... You've returned. Ready to sow some discord?
40.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player walks towards the imposing printer, rumbling away. - REUSE ANIMATION FROM N45

61.speaker: Narrator
61.text: *The smell of hot ink and whirr of machinery fills your senses as you approach the Baldur's Mouth printworks.*
61.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player walks towards the imposing printer, rumbling away. - REUSE ANIMATION FROM N45

71.speaker: Narrator
71.text: *The printing press whirrs furiously - hopefully Gortash's death will take your spot in the headlines.*
71.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player walks towards the imposing printer, rumbling away.

81.speaker: Printing Press
81.text: *As you get closer to the printworks, something odd happens. You hear it speak.*
81.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player walks towards the imposing printer, rumbling away.

86.speaker: Narrator
86.text: *As you get closer to the printworks, something odd happens. You hear it speak.*
86.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player walks towards the imposing printer, rumbling away.

89.speaker: Printing Press
89.text: Oi, gormless - not one step further! You are interrupting art.
89.context: NodeContext: the printer whispers this to itself

2.speaker: Player
2.text: Sorry to disturb you, but I need to change the next edition's headline.
2.context: CinematicNodeContext: there's a rumble as the articles are loosened, and a thunk on "there."

79.speaker: Narrator
79.text: Sorry to disturb you, but I need to change the next edition's headline.
79.context: CinematicNodeContext: there's a rumble as the articles are loosened, and a thunk on "there."

144.speaker: Printing Press
144.text: Sorry to disturb you, but I need to change the next edition's headline.
144.context: CinematicNodeContext: there's a rumble as the articles are loosened, and a thunk on "there."

154.speaker: Player
154.text: Sorry to disturb you, but I need to change the next edition's headline.
154.context: CinematicNodeContext: there's a rumble as the articles are loosened, and a thunk on "there."

147.speaker: Player
147.context: CinematicNodeContext: there's a rumble as the articles are loosened, and a thunk on "there."

113.speaker: Printing Press
113.text: My art! I'm an artiste. Name's Jelliwig.

108.speaker: Player
108.context: CinematicNodeContext: there's a rumble as the articles are loosened, and a thunk on "there."

69.speaker: Printing Press
69.context: CinematicNodeContext: there's a rumble as the articles are loosened, and a thunk on "there."

47.speaker: Player
47.text: I need to change an article in the next edition.
47.context: CinematicNodeContext: there's a rumble as the articles are loosened, and a thunk on "there."

13.speaker: Player
13.context: CinematicNodeContext: there's a rumble as the articles are loosened, and a thunk on "there."

85.speaker: Printing Press
85.text: Are you addled in the head? I am no chattering contraption, I am a person. An artist. Name's Jelliwig.
85.context: CinematicNodeContext: there's a rumble as the articles are loosened, and a thunk on "there."

133.speaker: Printing Press
133.text: This is my paintbrush. I make sure everything that's in those big ugly article blocks becomes fine printed artistry. I'm a master pensman, I am.
133.context: CinematicNodeContext: there's a rumble as the articles are loosened, and a thunk on "there."

153.speaker: Printing Press
153.text: Dolly can't stop talking about you. Hero this, hero that, hero here, hero there. Hello, hero.
153.context: CinematicNodeContext: there's a rumble as the articles are loosened, and a thunk on "there."

17.speaker: Printing Press
17.text: You know, there's some absolute filth about you in tomorrow's edition. Seeing as you were kind enough to free Dolly, how's about I do you a favour?
17.context: CinematicNodeContext: there's a rumble as the articles are loosened, and a thunk on "there."

145.speaker: Printing Press
145.text: Why don't we change the headline? We can load up something a bit less... damaging for your reputation?
145.context: CinematicNodeContext: there's a rumble as the articles are loosened, and a thunk on "there."

121.speaker: Player
121.context: CinematicNodeContext: there's a rumble as the articles are loosened, and a thunk on "there."

22.speaker: Player
22.context: CinematicNodeContext: there's a rumble as the articles are loosened, and a thunk on "there."

64.speaker: Printing Press
64.text: Well, first, I've got to release the old, nasty top story. Oooh, there. Now, you've got to find a new article to replace it.
64.context: CinematicNodeContext: there's a rumble as the articles are loosened, and a thunk on "there."

27.speaker: Player
27.text: I don't want to meddle with the paper.

50.speaker: Printing Press
50.text: BORING. You deserve exactly what Ettvard prints about you - I might even add a footnote about you having the clap.

19.speaker: Printing Press
19.text: Now scram it. One mistake and the reputation of Baldur's Mouth Gazette crumbles to dust.

16.speaker: Printing Press
16.text: Now scram it. One mistake and the reputation of Baldur's Mouth Gazette crumbles to dust.

72.speaker: Player
72.text: There's an article about me in the next edition - I need to stop it printing.

77.speaker: Printing Press
77.text: Oho... really? There was that rather defamatory headline... Yes, I see the resemblance.

20.speaker: Printing Press
20.text: Think you're clever? It takes a lot of craft to write trash this good.

126.speaker: Printing Press
126.text: Where's your gazette's Golden Quill Award for Truth and Excellence? Don't have one? Bloody thought not.

76.speaker: Player
76.text: I'd love to see an example of your work.

45.speaker: Player
45.text: I'm actually a great admirer of your work - may I see?

92.text: Ahah, someone who appreciates the art of words. And a celebrity to boot. You'll enjoy this.

118.speaker: Printing Press
118.text: Ahah, someone who appreciates the art of words. And a celebrity to boot. You'll enjoy this.

49.speaker: Printing Press
49.text: As it happens, the next edition has an article about you. Ooh, it's a mean one, too - real nasty. Ettvard must really have it out for you. Hard luck.
49.context: CinematicNodeContext: there's a rumble as the articles are loosened, and a thunk on "there."

7.speaker: Printing Press
7.text: Will require a delicate touch to spruce up. Think I'll need my number seven pen. Real sharp.
7.context: CinematicNodeContext: there's a rumble as the articles are loosened, and a thunk on "there."

74.speaker: Player
74.text: You need to stop it from being printed.
74.context: CinematicNodeContext: there's a rumble as the articles are loosened, and a thunk on "there."

28.speaker: Printing Press
28.text: I'm afraid I can't help you. I've got a good thing going here - letting you swap out a whole article might get Ettvard suspicious.

124.speaker: Player
124.text: Maybe you could do me a favour and stop the presses? Change the article?
124.context: CinematicNodeContext: there's a rumble as the articles are loosened, and a thunk on "there."

18.speaker: Player
18.text: What does Ettvard have against me?
18.context: CinematicNodeContext: there's a rumble as the articles are loosened, and a thunk on "there."

136.speaker: Printing Press
136.text: I wouldn't take it too personal. Ettvard gets his lines from up top, then gets all worked up over it.
136.context: CinematicNodeContext: there's a rumble as the articles are loosened, and a thunk on "there."

0.speaker: Printing Press
0.text: Although, it not being personal doesn't change how shafted you'll be.
0.context: CinematicNodeContext: there's a rumble as the articles are loosened, and a thunk on "there."

9.speaker: Player
9.text: Then get out my way. I need to clear my reputation.
9.context: CinematicNodeContext: there's a rumble as the articles are loosened, and a thunk on "there."

131.speaker: Player
131.text: Help me change the article or I'll banish you from the printer.
131.context: CinematicNodeContext: there's a rumble as the articles are loosened, and a thunk on "there."

98.speaker: Printing Press
98.text: Now, I'm not sure you could get me out of here, but I'm not taking any bloody chances.
98.context: CinematicNodeContext: there's a rumble as the articles are loosened, and a thunk on "there."

48.speaker: Printing Press
48.text: Now, I'm not sure you could get me out of here, but I'm not taking any bloody chances.
48.context: CinematicNodeContext: there's a rumble as the articles are loosened, and a thunk on "there."

141.speaker: Printing Press
141.text: Right. Let's get this article nice and loose... There. You'll need to find a replacement piece, of course. Make sure it's a good one.
141.context: CinematicNodeContext: there's a rumble as the articles are loosened, and a thunk on "there."

32.speaker: Player
32.text: Where can I find the stuff to print a new broadsheet?

100.speaker: Printing Press
100.text: Listen, mate. I'm already doing you a favour. I'm sure you can figure it out yourself.

120.speaker: Printing Press
120.text: As the old saying goes: 'Ours is not to wonder why, ours is but to print or die.' Or something like that.

55.speaker: Player
55.text: I have an article. Let's get started.

129.speaker: Player
129.text: I'll get on with finding an article.

46.text: You lie worse than Ettvard spells. If you care so much, change them yourself. I have work to do.

59.speaker: Printing Press
59.text: You lie worse than Ettvard spells. If you care so much, change them yourself. I have work to do.

26.speaker: Narrator
26.text: *There is a brief, disgruntled huff, then no more noises from the fey creature. It seems you are on your own.*

36.speaker: Player
36.text: Force the printing press open and clear the loaded headline.

148.speaker: Narrator
148.text: *You manage to clear the printer's load. It is ready for a new headline.*

33.text: *You fumble unsuccessfully with the printer and hear a loud thud. The machine leaps into life, printing whatever was already inside.*

29.speaker: Narrator
29.text: *You fumble unsuccessfully with the printer and hear a loud thud. The machine leaps into life, printing whatever was already inside.*

60.speaker: Player
60.text: Reach inside and carefully remove the loaded headline.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: Reach inside and carefully remove the loaded headline.

142.speaker: Player
142.text: Wrench the printing press open and rip out the loaded headline.

110.speaker: Printing Press
110.text: It'll suck to be you tomorrow, mate.

11.speaker: Player
11.text: Wouldn't changing the article be delightfully naughty?
11.context: NodeContext: offended and a little huffy

56.speaker: Printing Press
56.text: You would twist my love of mischief-making for your own perverse needs? Despicable.

139.speaker: Printing Press
139.text: You would twist my love of mischief-making for your own perverse needs? Despicable.

35.text: A-ha! A meddler after my own heart - wonderful.

73.speaker: Printing Press
73.text: A-ha! A meddler after my own heart - wonderful.

102.speaker: Player
102.text: Do it, you stupid creature. Unless you want to be ripped apart, piece by piece?
102.context: NodeContext: offended and a little huffy

84.text: All right, all right! No need for violence.
84.context: NodeContext: offended and a little huffy

53.speaker: Printing Press
53.text: All right, all right! No need for violence.
53.context: NodeContext: offended and a little huffy

156.speaker: Player
156.text: Do it, or I'll melt you into a steaming puddle of iron and regret.

23.speaker: Player
23.text: Too bad Ettvard will never get to enjoy it - I killed him.

63.speaker: Player
63.text: I agree. The right words at the right time - literal magic. We're alike, you and I.

1.speaker: Printing Press
1.text: FINE! Have it your way! No appreciation of art, these bloody arm-havers.

34.text: *You feel a dancing, mischievous magic sparking through air around the printer. A fey creature resides within.*

155.speaker: Narrator
155.text: *You feel a dancing, mischievous magic sparking through air around the printer. A fey creature resides within.*

52.speaker: Player
52.text: A talking printer? Fey magic never ceases to amaze.

31.speaker: Narrator
31.text: *A familiar magic dances around the printer, reminiscent of your own hag-touched eye. A fey creature resides within the machine.*

95.speaker: Printing Press
95.text: Paper's printing right now, pal. Should be on the streets tomorrow.
95.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player walks towards the imposing printer, rumbling away.

96.speaker: Printing Press
96.text: Paper's printing right now, pal. Should be on the streets tomorrow.
96.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player walks towards the imposing printer, rumbling away.

97.speaker: Printing Press
97.text: I may not like you, but I loved the look Ettvard had on his face when he saw the broadsheet. Well played, mortal.
97.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player walks towards the imposing printer, rumbling away.

107.speaker: Narrator
107.text: *You approach the printer, noting its ink splots and intricate cogs. Before you can get closer, however, it begins to speak.*
107.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player walks towards the imposing printer, rumbling away.

130.speaker: Printing Press
130.text: Oi! Gormless! Over here. Thought I recognised you. Dolly Dolly Dolly was right - you aren't much of a looker.

116.speaker: Printing Press
116.text: We both love cheeky words. She does all the shouting, I do the writing.

75.speaker: Player
75.text: Am I going mad or are you a talking printer?

146.speaker: Player
146.text: Let me guess - another fey who needs freeing?

10.speaker: Printing Press
10.text: I'm not trapped, you fool. This printing machine is just marvellous. We've nothing like it in the Feywild.

111.speaker: Narrator
111.text: *The printing press is running at full tilt. You don't see any way to interfere with it now without losing several fingers.*
111.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player walks towards the imposing printer, rumbling away. - REUSE ANIMATION FROM N45

115.speaker: Narrator
115.text: *The printer whirrs, ready to print an edition with the currently loaded headline.*
115.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player walks towards the imposing printer, rumbling away. - REUSE ANIMATION FROM N45

125.speaker: Narrator
125.text: *The machine whirrs noisily as your broadsheet prints.*

134.speaker: Printing Press
134.text: Ohohoho... Ettvard was fuming this morn... What a grand jape. It's best we lie low for a while, though - don't want him figuring us out.
